SEARCH
Package ygong.APS

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
ygong.APS.Scheduler
public class Scheduler extends Object
The Scheduler class is used to generate all possible schedules and calculate the grade for each schedule based on the weights given.

The Scheduler class can be used to generate all possible schedules and calculate the grade for each schedule based on the weights given. The Scheduler class can also be used to generate random schedules based on the given parameters.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Yuyang Gong

  • Field Details

    • _schedules

      private final List<Schedule> _schedules
      The list of all schedules generated by the Scheduler

    • _futures

      private final ArrayList<Future<Double>> _futures
      The list of all futures generated by the Scheduler

      Used for depthFirstSearch(int, Schedule) to store the futures of Scheduler.scheduleOrder for each schedule to precisely calculate the start/end time with the switch time.

    • _num_threads

      private final int _num_threads
      Number of threads created in the ExecutorService

      Defined at Scheduler(int) by the int or
      default to Runtime.availableProcessors() - 1 at Scheduler()

    • _executor

      private ExecutorService _executor
      The ExecutorService to manage the threads

    • _num_production_types

      private int _num_production_types
      number of production types
      e.g. 3 types of products each with different production pace on different machines and also have different switch time between each other

    • _num_machines

      private int _num_machines
      number of machines/production lines/production units... Order

    • _num_orders

      private int _num_orders
      number of orders/products/goods need to be scheduled

    • _max_units_allowed

      private int _max_units_allowed
      the 'maximum'(actually recommend) units allowed for all orders to be schedules

    • _max_capacity_per_machine

      private double _max_capacity_per_machine
      the maximum capacity that can be Overload on machine
      e.g. We have 40 units of _max_units_allowed on a machine with 1.5 Scheduler._max_capacity_per_machine. Then we allowed total 40*1.5= 60 units of rough working time on each machine
      See Also:
      • Rules

    • _min_capacity_per_machine

      private double _min_capacity_per_machine
      the minimum capacity that a machine can work.
      Similar to _max_capacity_per_machine
      e.g. We have 40 units of _max_units_allowed on each machine with 0.5 Scheduler._min_capacity_per_machine. Then we have 40*0.5= 20 units of rough working time on each machine. If the machine works less than 20 units, the schedule is invalid.
      See Also:
      • Rules

    • _min_makespan

      private double _min_makespan
      the minimum makespan of all schedules
      Note:
      this is the precisely calculated makespan including the switch time between different orders

    • _order_type_switch_times

      private ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> _order_type_switch_times
      the switch time between different order types
      See Also:
      • Schedule.scheduleAllOrders(Scheduler)
      • Schedule.MachineWithOrders.scheduleAllOrders(Scheduler)

    • _orders

      private ArrayList<Order> _orders
      the list of all orders need to be scheduled
      See Also:
      • Order

    • _machines

      private ArrayList<Machine> _machines
      the list of all machines need to be scheduled
      See Also:
      • Machine

  • Constructor Details

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler()
      Default constructor

      Default to Runtime.availableProcessors() - 1 number of threads in the ExecutorService

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler(int num_threads)
      Constructor with the number of threads in the ExecutorService
      Parameters:
      num_threads - the number of threads in the ExecutorService

      The number of threads should be greater than zero

      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the number of threads is less than or equal to zero

  • Method Details

    • depthFirstSearch

      private void depthFirstSearch(int order_index, Schedule schedule) throws AssertionError
      Recursion method to generate all possible schedules
      Parameters:
      order_index - the index of the order to be scheduled
      schedule - the current schedule
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the schedule is null or the order index is greater than the number of orders
      See Also:
      • generateAllPossible()
      • Schedule.MachineWithOrders.addOrder(Order)

    • generateAllPossible

      public void generateAllPossible()
      Generate all possible schedules

      Generate all possible schedules by DFS and store them in the _schedules list

      See Also:
      • depthFirstSearch(int, Schedule)

    • init

      public void init(int num_order_types, int num_machines, int num_orders, int max_units_allowed, double max_capacity_per_machine, double min_capacity_per_machine, ArrayList<Machine> machines, ArrayList<Order> orders, ArrayList<ArrayList<Double>> order_type_switch_times)
      The init method to initialize the Scheduler with the given parameters
      Read in all the fields that needed to schedule the orders
      Parameters:
      num_order_types - the number of order types
      num_machines - the number of machines
      num_orders - the number of orders
      max_units_allowed - the maximum units allowed for all orders to be scheduled
      max_capacity_per_machine - the maximum capacity that can be Overload on a machine
      min_capacity_per_machine - the minimum capacity that a machine can work
      machines - the list of all machines
      orders - the list of all orders
      order_type_switch_times - the switch time between different order types
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the number of machines/orders/order types is not equal to the size of the machines/orders.order types list

    • initRandom

      public void initRandom(int num_order_types, int num_machines, int num_orders, int max_units_allowed, double max_capacity_per_machine, double min_capacity_per_machine, Integer... seed) throws AssertionError
      The init method to initialize the Scheduler with random orders and machines just use for demo/test
      Parameters:
      num_order_types - the number of order types
      num_machines - the number of machines
      num_orders - the number of orders
      max_units_allowed - the maximum units allowed for all orders to be scheduled
      max_capacity_per_machine - the maximum capacity that can be Overload on a machine
      min_capacity_per_machine - the minimum capacity that a machine can work
      seed - the random seed
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the number of order types, machines, orders, max units allowed, max capacity per machine, min capacity per machine is less than or equal to zero or the max capacity per machine is less than the min capacity per machine
      See Also:
      • init(int, int, int, int, double, double, ArrayList, ArrayList, ArrayList)

    • calcAllSchedulesGrade

      public void calcAllSchedulesGrade(Integer... weights)
      Calculate the grade for all schedules based on the weights given
      Parameters:
      weights - the weights for on_time, makespan, est_violate, ldt_violate. if not given, the default weights are used: on_time: 40, makespan: 30, est_violate: 15, ldt_violate: 15
      See Also:
      • Schedule.calcGradeByWeights(int, int, int, int)
      API Note:
      The Schedules will be sorted by grade in descending order after the call

    • getSchedules

      public ArrayList<Schedule> getSchedules()
      Returns:
      the list of all schedules

    • createChart

      public GanttChart<Number,String> createChart(int index)
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the schedule in _schedules
      Returns:
      the GanttChart of the schedule
      See Also:
      • createChart(Schedule)

    • createChart

      public GanttChart<Number,String> createChart(Schedule schedule)
      Create a GanttChart of the schedule
      Parameters:
      schedule - the schedule to be displayed
      Returns:
      the GanttChart of the schedule
      API Note:
      we need the Scheduler to calculate the switch time between different order types, so it is not static

    • getSwitchTime

      protected double getSwitchTime(int i, int j) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Parameters:
      i - the order type of the first order
      j - the order type of the second order
      Returns:
      the switch time from order type i to order type j
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i or j is out of bound

      Returns:

    • getMinMakespan

      public double getMinMakespan()
      Returns:
      the minimum makespan of all schedules

    • getBestSchedule

      public List<Schedule> getBestSchedule()
      Returns:
      the list of all orders

    • getBestSchedule

      public List<Schedule> getBestSchedule(int num)
      Parameters:
      num - if num is positive, return the first num schedules; if num is negative, return the last num schedules; if num is zero, return all schedules
      Returns:
      the list of the best schedules
      See Also:
      • calcAllSchedulesGrade(Integer...)
      • Schedule.scheduleAllOrders(Scheduler)
      API Note:
      Need to first call calcAllSchedulesGrade(Integer...) to get a sorted list of schedules otherwise is just a list of schedules!

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Override the toString function
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the Scheduler
